content.en: There are many days for the new year all over the world. Why? Well, different cultures use different calendars.
content.tw: 你知道世界新年的日子很不一樣嗎? 因為每一個文化有自己特別的月曆。

content.en: Today is New Year's Day on the calendar most countries use. It's solar. It uses the sun.
content.tw: 大部分的國家都是今天過新年，因為他們用陽曆來算時間。

content.en: Now it's month seven on a different calendar. Muslims use this calendar. It's lunar. It uses the moon. The new year is in June on the calendar that most countries use. It begins when a new moon comes.
content.tw: 但是對於伊斯蘭教徒而言，現在是陰曆的七月，他們用月亮計算時間，新年是在我們陽曆的六月。

content.en: In Taiwan, we say our calendar is lunar. But it's not! It uses the moon AND the sun! The new year begins when the new moon closest to the first day of spring comes. It's between January 21st and February 21st on the calendar most countries use.
content.tw: 那台灣也使用陰曆嗎? 其實我們的農曆，是同時用太陽跟月亮算時間! 新年會在春天第一個新月慶祝，通常在陽曆的1月21日到2月21日之間。

content.en: Now it's the Year of the Dragon. Soon it'll be the Year of the Snake!
content.tw: 現在是龍年，但我們很快就要迎接蛇年!

content.en: Tomorrow, we're talking about celebrations! How are you celebrating the New Year?
content.tw: 明天，我們要聊聊慶祝活動！你打算怎麼慶祝新年呢？

vocabulary.preface: 不同的文化，造成有的國家用陽曆，有的用陰曆。

content.text: 1. snake 蛇。Did you know this year is the Year of the Snake? 你可知道今年是蛇年?I thought it's the Year of the Dragon. 我以為是龍年。
2. January 一月。Guess I'm still stuck in last year's calendar. 我還卡在去年的月曆呢。You are always one month behind.你老是落後一個月。What's next? 之後會怎樣?Celebrating January in February? 二月時慶祝一月?
3. lunar 月球的。Well, at least I'm not tracking time with a lunar calendar.至少我不用陰曆計時。I like the lunar calendar! 我喜歡陰曆!
4. New Year 新年。It reminds me of when to eat zongzi or moon cake.它提醒我哪時候吃粽子或是月餅。My favorite one is still Lunar New Year's Eve dinner. 我最喜歡的還是年夜飯。

vocabulary.postscript: 來一起複習單字。snake蛇 January一月 lunar月球的 New Year新年

quiz.question: 1. What kind of calendar do most countries use?
2. Who uses the calendar that's on month seven now??
3. What does a lunar calendar use?
options: c. The moon and the sun

title: New Year's Special (Part II): Party Time!

content.en: Yesterday was about calendars. Today, we're talking about celebrations!
content.tw: 昨天大家認識了各國的月曆，今天來聊聊不同的慶祝方式!

content.en: This week, around the world, people partied! They said goodbye to 2024. They welcomed the New Year!
content.tw: 世界各地都在這個禮拜辦派對! 一起向 2024 年 說掰掰，迎接新年!

content.en: All over Taiwan, many, many people celebrated at big parties. They saw famous singers and dancers! They watched exciting fireworks!
content.tw: 跨年時，台灣很多地方都會有藝人表演，大家還喜歡擠在一起看煙火秀!

content.en: Asia also has New Year celebrations at other times. The Persian New Year is in March. People plan it for many weeks. It is for 13 days! Families and friends give gifts and share food.
content.tw: 亞洲有些地方在不同的時間過節，三月是波斯的新年，總共慶祝13天! 家人朋友會花很多時間準備禮物跟聚餐。

content.en: The Thai New Year is in April. It's famous all over the world! People celebrate it with a big water fight! They run on the streets and throw water at each other! It's lots of fun! They do it to get clean for the New Year!
content.tw: 泰國新年也超好玩! 每年4月，人們會用一場潑水大戰來慶祝！他們在路上跑來跑去、互相潑水，並用水沖走壞運氣!

content.en: Tomorrow we're talking about food! Does your family eat together for the New Year?
content.tw: 明天我們將討論食物！你的家人會一起慶祝新年嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 過新年有很多種不同的方式，重點是跟親友一起歡度。

content.text: 1. celebrate 慶祝。 I really hope to go to Thailand to celebrate their New Year! 我好希望去泰國慶祝新年! For Songkran, right? 參加潑水節嗎? Right, you've been there?對，你去過?
2. throw 扔。 No, but I've heard so much about it ! 沒有，但是聽說過很多次。 Yeah, throwing water at people you don't know… 對啊，潑水到陌生人身上... And they won't get angry? 他們還不會生氣? That's crazy! 太狂了!
3. lots of 很多的。 Don't forget they'll throw water at you too. 別忘了他們也會對你潑水。 I'll bring a BIG water gun! 我會帶一支好大的水槍。 It must be lots of fun! 一定很好玩。
4. April 四月。 Is Songkran in March or April? 潑水節在三月還是四月? In April, I believe. 我想是四月。

vocabulary.postscript: 來一起讀單字。 celebrate慶祝 throw扔 lots of很多的 April四月

quiz.question: 1. How long is the Persian New Year?
2. When is the Persian New Year?
3. How do people celebrate the Thai New Year?
options: c. They have a big water fight.

title: 新年特輯：世界各地的節慶食物

content.en: It's 2025! HAPPY NEW YEAR! Welcome to our three-part New Year's Special!
content.tw: 2025年到了！新年快樂！歡迎來到我們的三部新年特輯！

content.en: Yesterday was about New Year's celebrations. Today, we're talking about food!
content.tw: 昨天介紹的慶祝方式都很有趣，那不同國家會吃什麼食物來迎接新年呢?

content.en: Sharing food with family and friends is very important. Many cultures have special foods for New Year's.
content.tw: 新年和家人朋友聚餐很重要，不過每一個文化吃的食物不同。

content.en: In India, this year's New Year is in March. It has some lucky foods. Lentils are lucky. They look like coins! Fish are lucky too. They shine like silver. People eat these lucky lentils and fish. They want to get rich!
content.tw: 印度的新年在今年三月，他們會吃一些帶來好運的食物，譬如長得像硬幣的扁豆，還有像白銀一樣閃閃發亮的魚，希望新的一年能發財!

content.en: The Jewish New Year is celebrated all over the world. It's in September. It has many delicious foods. The most famous is cut apples with honey. It's sweet and delicious! Families eat it for a sweet New Year.
content.tw: 猶太教徒在九月慶祝新年，它們的蘋果切片配蜂蜜很有名，家人會一起吃這道甜點，期待新的一年甜甜蜜蜜!

content.en: Do you eat special foods for your New Year's celebration? What are they?
content.tw: 那你會吃什麼來慶祝新年呢?有什麼特別意義嗎?

content.en: That's all for our three-part New Year's Special! We looked at calendars, celebrations, and food from around the world! Whenever you celebrate, have a Happy New Year!
content.tw: 這就是我們新年三部曲的全部內容了！我們探討了世界各地的日曆、慶祝活動和食物！無論你何時慶祝，祝你新年快樂！

vocabulary.preface: 很多食物有吉祥的涵義，特別適合新年。

content.text: 1. special 特別的. What special food do you usually have for the Lunar New Year? 你農曆新年通常會吃什麼特別的東西? Let's see… fish, of course, 我來想想，當然會吃魚， meaning we'll have an abundant year every year. 意思是年年有餘。
2. look like 看起來像. Dumplings, too, because they look like yuan-bao,也吃餃子，因為它看起來像元寶， and will bring prosperity.會帶來興旺。
3. delicious 美味的. I enjoy eating dumplings! 我喜歡餃子。 They are delicious with soy sauce and vinegar.搭配醬油跟醋，很好吃!
4. share 分享. Isn't it wonderful to share food with people you love? 跟自己所愛的人分享食物感覺真好。 Indeed. That's the best part of celebrations.那確實是最好的慶祝。

vocabulary.postscript: 你喜歡哪些美食? 請跟我讀單字。 special特別的 look like看起來像 delicious美味的 share分享

quiz.question: 1. When is the New Year in India this year?
2. Why are lentils lucky in India?
3. What is a famous Jewish New Year food?

title: Sailing the Humpback Highway to Help Save Humpbacks

content.en: The Maori are New Zealand's Indigenous people. Whales are important to them. These very big ocean animals gave the Maori meat, milk, oil, and more.
content.tw: 毛利人是紐西蘭原住民，座頭鯨對他們很重要，它提供了鯨魚肉、奶、魚油等資源。

content.en: The Maori went from Polynesia to New Zealand long ago. They say whales kept them safe on the sea. So the Maori are called "whale riders."
content.tw: 毛利人被稱為鯨魚騎士，他們認為很久以前是因為座頭鯨的保護，才能從波利尼西亞來到紐西蘭。

content.en: Every year, these whales swim from New Zealand to Polynesia. They swim one thousand six hundred kilometers! The way they go is called the "humpback highway."
content.tw: 每一年，座頭鯨從紐西蘭游到波利尼西亞，總共要游一千六百公里! 這條路線被稱為「座頭鯨公路」！

content.en: One hundred years ago, there were twenty thousand humpback whales. There are about ten thousand now. They need to be kept safe. The Maori want the world to know this.
content.tw: 一百年前，有兩萬頭座頭鯨，現在只剩下大約一萬頭。毛利人希望全世界知道，這些鯨魚需要被保護。

content.en: They sent ten Indigenous women sailors to the humpback highway. The sailors sailed a small Polynesian ship. This kind of ship has been used for thousands of years.
content.tw: 毛利人派出十個女水手，搭一種有千年歷史的小船，到「座頭鯨公路」。

content.en: The women took DNA from the humpback highway. Now New Zealand scientists can find out which whales are swimming there.
content.tw: 他們收集鯨魚DNA，讓紐西蘭的科學家研究游過那裡的鯨魚。

content.en: The sailors were heroes helping humpbacks!
content.tw: 這些水手是幫助座頭鯨的英雄！

vocabulary.preface: 座頭鯨是跟紐西蘭原住民毛利人關係密切，被當作保護神。

content.text: 1. big 大的。I wonder how big a humpback whale is. 我想知道座頭鯨有多大。It's very big, about 15 meters long. 很大，有十五公尺長。Oh my, that's as long as three cars put together! 天哪，那跟三部車放在一起那麼長!
2. ocean 海洋。Imagine seeing that ocean giant rising by your boat. 想想看就在你的船旁邊冒出這個海洋巨獸。That would be like in a movie! 那會像在電影裡一樣。
3. animal 動物。You're a good swimmer. 你很會游泳。You could then swim with the animal. 就可以跟那個動物一起游泳。
4. people 人群。Swimming with a humpback whale? 跟座頭鯨一起游泳? No, I'd prefer to swim with people. 不了，我比較喜歡跟人游泳。

vocabulary.postscript:
你有親眼見過鯨魚嗎?
big大的 ocean海洋 animal動物 people人群

quiz.question: 1. What kind of whale are New Zealand scientists studying?
2. What did researchers take from the sea during their trip?
3. How far do the whales swim to Polynesia?
options: a. One thousand six hundred kilometers

title: Drones Kill Fire Ants in Taiwan

content.en: Do you live near fire ants? Be careful! These ants are worse than other ants. They bite! Then they sting! Three to seven times! OUCH! That hurts a lot!
content.tw: 你住的地方附近有紅火蟻嗎? 這種可怕的螞蟻會叮咬人三到七次，非常痛!

content.en: Farmers don't like fire ants. These ants eat everything. They eat fruit and vegetables. They eat insects and small animals. And fire ants are hard to kill.
content.tw: 農夫很討厭紅火蟻，因為牠們會把蔬菜水果類的農作物都吃掉，還會吃其他的昆蟲跟小動物，而且很難消滅。

content.en: These ants came to Taiwan about twenty years ago. Maybe they were in the mud on the bottom of planes. Now there are many fire ants here.
content.tw: 可能是在二十多年前藏在飛機底部的泥土裡，被帶到台灣，現在台灣有好多!

content.en: But Taiwan is fighting fire ants. It uses ant food. It puts something that kills ants in the food. Many times, people or trucks put this ant food on the ground. But in some places, it's hard to do this.
content.tw: 政府努力對抗紅火蟻，把下了毒的螞蟻食物放在地上，但是只靠人來做這件事太困難了。

content.en: So Taiwan is using drones to kill fire ants. They put the same ant food on the ground!
content.tw: 所以現在政府改用無人機來消滅紅火蟻，無人機可以很快把下毒的食物鋪滿地上。

content.en: The drones work very well. There are fewer fire ants! Phew!
content.tw: 無人機運作得很好，紅火蟻的數量減少了！呼！

vocabulary.preface: 紅火蟻是外來種，咬人又痛又癢，必須予以控制。

content.text: 1. kill 殺死. Waaah! Kill that cockroach !! 打死那隻蟑螂! There. I got it. 好了，打到了。 Thank you so much! 真謝謝你! Why are you so afraid of them? 你為什麼那麼怕蟑螂?
2. worse 更糟的. They are ugly, and they fly. 牠們很醜，還會飛。 Mosquitoes fly. 蚊子也會飛。 Roaches are much worse than mosquitoes! 蟑螂比蚊子壞多了。
3. fruit 水果. They get onto food, such as the fruit I left in the kitchen.
4. many 很多的. Many insects love fruit. 很多昆蟲都喜歡水果。 Ants, flies and even butterflies love it. 螞蟻，蒼蠅，甚至蝴蝶都喜歡。 Maybe, but they don't come into my house.也許吧，但是牠們不會進到我家。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字你記住了嗎? kill殺死 worse更糟的 fruit水果 many很多的

quiz.question: 1. How many times do fire ants sting?
2. When did fire ants first come to Taiwan?
3. How do drones kill fire ants?

content.en: Wow! There are so many trees here! Look to your left! Trees! Look to your right! There are more trees! We are in a forest, right?
content.tw: 哇！這裡有好多樹木！左看右看都是高大的樹，我們走在森林裡，對吧?

content.en: Well, yes. But we are also in a very old city. Many people lived in this city a thousand years ago.
content.tw: 其實這裡曾經是一座非常古老的城市，大約一千年前，還住了很多人。

content.en: Scientists say the city needed more water. So people went to live in other places. Then one day, there were no more people here. More and more trees grew. Leaves fell from the trees. Many years later, the city was under a forest! Nobody could see it. Everybody forgot this city.
content.tw: 科學家說這個城市很缺水，所以越來越多人搬家，直到有一天，全部的人都離開了，城市長滿了樹，變成森林，再也沒有人記得這裡的歷史。

content.en: Then a student found the city! No, he wasn't walking around. He was sitting at his desk. He saw some pictures of the forest. He studied them. He found the city in the pictures!
content.tw: 直到最近，一個學生找到了這座老城市！他完全沒有出門，只是研究那座森林的照片，就發現裡面有一座城市！

content.en: This city is in Mexico. It's about half the size of Taipei. It has almost seven thousand buildings. There's a pool, a big place to play games with balls, and more!
content.tw: 這座城市在墨西哥，大概是台北的一半大，裡面保存了 7000 棟老建築，還有游泳池、古老球場等等，非常珍貴。

content.en: There are many things in the world to find! Maybe one day you will find something!
content.tw: 世界上有很多東西等著被發現！也許有一天你也會有所發現！

vocabulary.preface: 這名考古學學生利用科技，穿透熱帶樹林，找到墨西哥的古老城市。

content.text:
1. fall 落下。
Look at all the leaves falling! 你看那些葉子掉下來。Isn't it pretty?
不是很美嗎?
Yeah, so colorful.是啊，好多種顏色。

2. everybody 每個人。
I think everybody should visit the mountains. 我認為每個人都應該拜訪山林。
They would feel happy by enjoying nature. 欣賞大自然就會很快樂。

3. right 右邊。
Oh, look to the right! 你看右邊! That tree looks very old. 那棵樹看起來好老。
And very big, too. It must be a ginkgo tree. 並且也好大，一定是銀杏。

4. grow 種植。
I have to find a way to grow a ginkgo tree. 我得找到辦法來種銀杏。
In your garden? 種在你的花園裡嗎? 我希望你找到。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like walking in a forest? 來一起讀單字。

fall落下 everybody每個人 right右邊 grow種植

quiz.question: 1. How did the student find the city?
2. Where is the city?
3. About how many buildings were found?

content.en: Bananas... yum! Guatemala and Belize, countries in Central America, grow bananas. Taiwan grows bananas too. It knows a lot about bananas! It helps these countries keep their banana plants healthy.
content.tw: 中美洲的貝里斯跟瓜地馬拉兩個國家，種的香蕉都很好吃。是台灣幫助他們維持香蕉樹的健康喔！

content.en: Taiwan watches these plants... from space! It can find sick banana plants.
content.tw: 台灣會從外太空觀察這些香蕉樹！有生病的樹就會馬上被看出來。

content.en: In sick plants, the leaves go from green to yellow. They get dark spots. Sick plants can't grow good bananas.
content.tw: 生病的植物葉子會從綠色變成黃色，還會長出黑色的斑點。

content.en: But Taiwan doesn't look at the color from space. It looks at the light. When sunlight goes down to leaves, some of the light goes back up. More light goes back up from healthy leaves than sick leaves.
content.tw: 但是，台灣並不是從太空看葉子的顏色，而是觀察光線。陽光照在葉子上時，健康的葉子反射的光比生病的多。

content.en: From space, Taiwan can watch many banana plants. It watches banana plants in Guatemala and Belize. It has been doing this for three years.
content.tw: 台灣已經做這項工作三年了，從太空可以一次觀察到超級多的香蕉樹。

content.en: It helps farmers find sick plants fast. Then farmers take the sick plants away. This helps keep other plants healthy.
content.tw: 這個技術讓農夫可以很快發現生病的植物，才不會把疾病傳染給健康的香蕉樹。

content.en: Taiwan helps these countries grow healthy banana plants! Good job, Taiwan!
content.tw: 台灣幫助這些國家種植健康的香蕉樹！台灣做得好！

vocabulary.preface: 從外太空監測香蕉的生長，夠高科技了吧?

content.text: 1. farmer 農夫。 Did you know I'm thinking of becoming a farmer? 你知道我想變成農夫吧? A farmer? You? 農夫?你? What do you plan to grow? 你打算種什麼? Bananas! 香蕉!
2. watch 觀看。 I see. 我明白了。But do you even know how to take care of bananas? 但是你究竟知不知道怎麼照顧香蕉? Of course. I've watched a lot of videos. 當然啦，我看了好多影片。
3. keep 維持。 I just need to water it, keep it healthy 只需要澆水，保持它健康，and wait for the green bananas to turn yellow. 等著綠香蕉變黃就好了。
4. sick 生病的。 Uh-huh. And what happens if it gets sick? 要是它生病怎麼辦? It won't get sick under my care. 我照顧它不會生病的。

vocabulary.postscript: 你看過香蕉樹嗎? 一起讀今天的單字。 farmer農夫 watch觀看 keep維持 sick生病的

quiz.question: 1. What does Taiwan do to banana plants in Guatemala and Belize?
2. What do leaves on sick banana plants do?
3. What does Taiwan look at to find sick banana plants from space?

content.en: Lots of people want to live longer. Many people in Taiwan can live a long time. But how about longer?! Longer is better! So what's the best way to live longer?
content.tw: 很多人希望長命百歲，台灣很多人很長壽，但有了一些秘方後，我們也許能活更久！

content.en: Scientists in Taipei wanted to know. They studied 20,000 people. What made some of the people live longer?
content.tw: 台北的科學家研究了兩萬個不同年紀的人，想知道比較長壽的人有什麼祕訣？

content.en: The scientists looked at many things. What was the best? Was it exercise? Was it not smoking? Was it not drinking alcohol? Wait... was it eating healthy food?
content.tw: 科學家研究了好多不同的項目，像是：他們是因為運動才長壽嗎？還是不抽菸不喝酒？啊！會不會是健康的飲食呢？

content.en: Yes! The scientists found that eating fruits and vegetables was the best! People who ate them lived three years longer!
content.tw: 沒錯！原來多吃蔬菜水果的人，會比一般人多活三年！

content.en: Fruits and vegetables help make your body strong. They help keep your heart healthy. They help fight sickness. And they taste good! Mmmmm!
content.tw: 蔬菜水果讓你身體強壯，讓心臟更健康，還可以幫忙抵抗疾病，不只這樣喔，它們也很好吃！

content.en: The scientists say it's best to eat fruit four or more times a week. How about vegetables? It's best to eat them four or more times a week too!
content.tw: 科學家說一個禮拜要吃最少四次蔬菜跟水果，不過當然囉，蔬菜水果吃越多越好！

content.en: Do you want a longer life? You can start today! Eat an apple! ... or a banana! ... or an orange! ... or a carrot! ... or some broccoli...
content.tw: 你想要更長壽嗎？今天就可以開始！吃一顆蘋果！...或一根香蕉！...或一顆柳橙！...或一根紅蘿蔔！...或一些花椰菜...

vocabulary.preface: 多吃蔬菜水果好處多多，包括活得長長久久。

content.text:
1. best 最好的。
I can tell you the best way to live longer. 我可以告訴你要長壽最好的辦法。
Okay, I’m all ears. 好，我在注意聽。

2. study 研究。
The secret is to take a nap every day. 祕訣是每天都小睡。
I’ve studied my parents’lifestyle.我研究過我爸媽的生活方式。

3. live 生活。
What did you learn? 你了解了什麼?
My father lived to 94 and my mom to 102. 我爸爸活到九十四歲，我媽媽到一百零二歲。
So? 所以呢?
They took a nap whenever they felt like it. 他們無論何時想睡就小睡一下。

4. healthy 健康的。
They were healthy and happy till the end.他們一直到最後都過得健康快樂。
That's very good advice. 這是很好的建議。I’m going to sleep now.我現在要睡了。

vocabulary.postscript: 你今天吃水果了嗎? 請跟我讀單字。 best最好的  study研究  live生活  healthy健康的

quiz.question: 1. How much longer can people live by eating more fruits and vegetables?
2. What do fruits and vegetables help fight?
3. How often is best to eat vegetables?
options: a. Four or more times a day
b. Four or more times a week
c. Four or more times a month

title: Making Clothes Colors Better for the Earth

content.en: Making Clothes Colors Better for the Earth Our clothes are many colors: blue pants, red dresses, yellow shirts. They look great! But giving clothes color is bad for the Earth.
content.tw: 我們的衣服五顏六色，但是把衣服染色其實對地球很不好。

content.en: Most clothes are made of cloth. Dye gives cloth a color. How? Dye goes into a lot of water. Then cloth goes into the colored water.
content.tw: 衣服是用布料做成的，我們將染劑放進水裡，再把布料浸泡到水裡染色。

content.en: But dye makes the water dirty. Every year, dye makes five trillion liters of water dirty. That's how much water all the people in Taiwan use in two years!
content.tw: 但是這些染料會讓水髒掉，每一年，染劑會污染五兆公升的水，大概是全部台灣人兩年會用到的水量！

content.en: It's hard to clean dye from water. The dirty water goes into lakes, rivers, and the sea. Plants need sunlight to grow. Dye in the water stops sunlight from getting to plants.
content.tw: 把染劑從水裡清乾淨超困難，髒水會流到河流或大海，也會讓植物照不到它們需要的陽光。

content.en: Are there good ways to give cloth color? Well, one company made a machine. It gives color to cloth with very little water. How? Dye goes onto cloth. The machine is like a big printer!
content.tw: 有沒有辦法用環保的方式染衣服呢？有！有一間公司做了很像印表機的機器，只要很少的水，就可以將染料直接印在衣服上。

content.en: Taiwan makes a lot of cloth. A Taiwanese company is using this machine in Taiwan now!
content.tw: 台灣製作很多布料，有一間公司正在用這樣的機器做衣服！

content.en: Maybe one day many companies will use this machine. Then a lot of water won't become dirty!
content.tw: 也許有一天，很多公司都會使用這台機器。這樣一來，就不會有大量的水被污染了！

vocabulary.preface: 染料是化學物質，會破壞自然環境。

content.text:
1. water 水。
Did you see the river today? 你今天有沒有看到那條河? The water looked so strange! 河水看起來好奇怪。
Oh no, what happened? 糟糕，發生了什麼事?

2. red 紅色，blue 藍色。
I think someone put waste water into the river.
我覺得有人把廢水倒進了河裡。
It was full of colors-red, blue and a bit of yellow.
它有很多顏色，紅的藍的，還有一點兒黃色。

3. dirty 骯髒的。
That's terrible! 糟透了!
The river must be quite dirty now. 那條河現在一定很髒。

4. company 公司。
The company that did it should be punished. 應該處罰做這件事的公司。
I agree.我同意。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字很容易記。
water水 red紅色，blue藍色 dirty骯髒的 company公司

quiz.question: 1. Why is dye bad for plants?
2. How many trillions of liters of water does dye make dirty every year?
3. How does the machine work?

title: Exercise is Good for the Brain

content.en: Exercise is good for our bodies. It helps make us healthy. It helps us fight sickness. It makes our bodies stronger! And it makes our brains bigger too! What?
content.tw: 我們都知道運動對身體很好，讓我們更強壯健康，但是你知道運動也會讓腦袋長大嗎？

content.en: Scientists studied ten thousand people. The youngest was 18 years old. The oldest was 97. The scientists asked them about exercise. How many times a week did they exercise? How hard did they exercise?
content.tw: 科學家找了一萬個人做測試，他們的年紀介於十八歲到九十七歲，科學家問他們每個星期運動幾次？還有喜歡做什麼運動？

content.en: Then the scientists used a machine. It let them look at the people's brains. The scientists found that people who exercised had bigger brains.
content.tw: 然後科學家用機器測量他們的腦袋，發現常常運動的人腦袋比較大顆！

content.en: They also found a little exercise can make brains bigger. Exercising two or three times a week is good! People can walk fast or move more. They don't have to run or exercise hard.
content.tw: 而且不用很激烈的健身，只要一個星期運動兩三次，像是快走或是多動動，就能幫助腦袋長大。

content.en: Many bigger brains are healthier. And bigger brains work better! This makes exercise very important.
content.tw: 比較大的腦袋，反應更快也更健康，所以運動真的很重要！

content.en: So try to exercise, if you can. It's good for your body and brain. Tell your parents and grandparents to exercise more, if they can. Everybody wants a better brain, right?
content.tw: 所以如果你可以的話，試著去運動。這對你的身體和大腦都有好處。如果你的父母和祖父母可以的話，告訴他們多運動。每個人都想要一個更好的大腦，對嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 運動可以增加腦容量，增強記憶力。

content.text:
1. brain 腦袋。
Should we walk or take the MRT? 我們走路還是搭捷運?
Let's walk.我們走路吧。It'll clear up my brain.可以讓我的腦袋清楚一點。

2. body 身體。
My brain is foggy too.我的腦袋也霧霧的。
Luckily my body works well. 我的身體倒是很好，運氣不錯。

3. how many times 幾次。
How many times do you work out every week? 你每個星期運動幾次?
Just four times.只有四次。
That's still a lot. 還是很多呢。

4. oldest 最老的。
The oldest guy at my gym is 87, I think.
我的健身房年紀最大的男生我想有八十七歲了。
He's there every day! 他每天都在那裏!
Wow, I hope I can be that strong at 87. 哇，我希望我八十七歲時也那麼壯!

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you exercise every week? 請跟我讀單字。
brain腦袋 body身體 how many times幾次 oldest最老的

quiz.question: 1. How many people did scientists study?
2. What makes brains bigger?
3. Why are bigger brains good?

title: Looking for Gold in New Taipei

content.en: Ugh! There's so much sand! My hands are tired. And I'm so cold. Maybe there isn't any … Wait! I see a shiny rock. It looks like gold! Woohoo!!
content.tw: 吼！好多沙子，挖得我手好酸，這裡怎麼可能會有...等等！這閃亮亮的石頭，該不會是黃金！

content.en: People are hurrying to a river in New Taipei. Many people think there's gold there. So they are trying to find it.
content.tw: 很多人都趕到新北市一條河流尋寶，因為他們相信那裡有黃金。

content.en: Why is there gold in the river? Well, people say it came down from the mountains.
content.tw: 為什麼河流會有黃金呢？因為河流從山上流下來，山上可能有黃金。

content.en: The price of gold is going up and up. People at the river think they can find gold. Then they want to sell it. But it's not easy to find. Many shiny rocks are not gold!
content.tw: 黃金價格越來越高，誰能找到就能賺一大筆錢。但是黃金可不好找！

content.en: Looking for gold is a lot of work. People dig up sand. They put the sand in a pan. They shake it. Maybe there's a little gold. Maybe there isn't!
content.tw: 人們會挖起沙子，放進平底鍋裡搖ㄧ搖，看看有沒有黃金小顆粒，但他們可能會失望。

content.en: Looking for gold is also dangerous. The river is fast and strong. The water is very cold. Lots of dirt and rocks can come down the mountains. And floods can happen very fast.
content.tw: 找黃金其實也很危險，因為河水又快又急，可能會有洪水，很多石頭也會隨著河水滾下來。

content.en: Do you want to find gold? Well, don't think about it! It's dangerous! Do something safe!
content.tw: 你想要找到黃金嗎？嗯，別考慮了！那很危險！做些安全的事吧！

vocabulary.preface: 颱風過後，在大水沖刷之下，河流裡有可能浮現黃金。

content.text:
1. river 河流。
Wow, people have found gold in a small river! 哇，有人在小河裡找到黃金。
Where? I want to see it.在哪裡?我想要看。

2. dig 挖掘。
You just want to see the gold,你只想看黃金，
or you want to dig it up yourself? 還是想自己去挖?
Can I do both? 我可以兩個都要嗎?

3. shake 搖晃。
But it takes a lot of work. 不過需要做很多事。
You have to do a lot of shaking to get the gold from the sand。你得用力搖，從泥沙裡淘金。

4. pan 盆子。
What do I need? 我需要什麼呢?
Let me get my pan.我去拿我的盆子。
That's so nice of you! 你人真好!
No problem. Just share the money with me. 沒問題，只要跟我分錢就好。

vocabulary.postscript:
來一起讀單字。
river河流 dig挖掘 shake搖晃 pan盆子

quiz.question: 1. Where are people digging for gold?
2. What is happening with the price of gold?
3. Why is the river dangerous for looking for gold?

title: Stand on Both Sides of Escalator Steps

content.en: Escalators are moving steps. They help people go up or down easily. They are in busy places. On most escalators, two people can stand or walk on one step.
content.tw: 手扶梯是一種移動式的樓梯，讓人們很容易地上下樓，手扶梯會在繁忙的地方，一般來說，可以讓兩個人同時站在左右兩側。

content.en: But in Taiwan, most people stand on the right side. People who are in a hurry walk up the left side.
content.tw: 但是台灣人習慣站在右側，左側會留給趕時間的人走。

content.en: The MRT in Taipei wants two people to stand on each step. More people can use the escalator this way. Everyone will move faster! When everyone stands on the right, everyone moves more slowly.
content.tw: 台北捷運希望大家能站在左右兩邊，這樣更多人能同時用手扶梯，也會更快抵達！

content.en: But most people in Taipei keep standing on the right side. People say it's hard to change. Some people want to walk up the escalators.
content.tw: 不過改變很困難，大部分台灣人還是站在右邊，讓左邊的人快速通過。

content.en: Many people use big MRT stations. The escalators have signs about standing safely. But there are no signs about standing on both sides. When there's a big event, MRT workers hold up signs about this. There may be signs by escalators soon.
content.tw: 在比較多人使用的捷運站，以後會有告示牌，建議大家站在左右兩側。

content.en: Standing on both sides helps people move faster. There are no long lines at busy times. What do you think? Will you stand on the left side next time?
content.tw: 大家站在兩側，就不需要大排長龍等手扶梯，你下次會想試試站在左側嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 捷運站的電動扶梯，兩邊都可以站立。

content.text:
1. stand 站立。
Nancy, why are you just standing there? 南西，你怎麼站在那裏? We need to go up the escalator. 我們得上手扶梯。 I don't trust escalators. 我不信任手扶梯。

2. walk 走路。
Can't we just walk up the stairs? 我們不能走樓梯嗎? They don't move and it feels safer. 樓梯不會動，感覺比較安全。 The escalator is safe! 手扶梯很安全啊!

3. move 移動。
What if it moves too fast? 要是它動得太快呢? It moves up or down, not "too fast". 它會往上或是往下，就是不會太快。

4. next time 下一次。
Now come on, we have a train to catch. 來吧，我們要趕火車呢。 Okay, but next time let's take the stairs. 好啦，不過下次要走樓梯。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字每天都用得到。 stand站立 walk走路 move移動 next time下一次

quiz.question: 1. Where does the MRT want people to stand on escalators?
2. What happens when people stand the way the MRT wants?
3. What may the MRT do to help people change?

content.en: Did you know there are worlds underground? They are in caves. Caves are spaces in the Earth. Some are very big. Some are small. And some people love to go into them.
content.tw: 你知道地底下有另外一種世界嗎？地底下有很多大大小小的洞穴，很多人喜歡去探險。

content.en: Caves have surprises. Some have rivers! Others have strange animals. They don't live anywhere else. Some very big caves have their own weather!
content.tw: 洞穴裡有很多驚喜哦！有河流，有只住在地底的奇怪動物，還有洞穴特有的天氣現象。

content.en: Going into caves is like going to the moon. Each step goes to a new place. No one has seen these places before!
content.tw: 走進洞穴裡，每一步就像在月球探險一樣，會發現從來沒有看過的新世界！

content.en: Caves tell us about the Earth's past. They can also tell us about climate change. And caves can show how things keep living when it's hard to live.
content.tw: 我們也能從洞穴知道地球的歷史，還有氣候的變化，還能觀察動植物怎麼在困難的環境下生活。

content.en: Caves can also help us understand life on other planets. Some caves have plants that can grow with almost no light!
content.tw: 洞穴有很多珍貴的知識，有一些植物甚至能在黑暗中生長！

content.en: Going deep into caves isn't easy. People walk on their hands and knees in some places. They go in very small spaces. They dive. There are dangers like earthquakes. But finding something new is very exciting!
content.tw: 洞穴探險很不容易，要跪在地上爬行、鑽進狹小的地方或是潛水，還可能遇到地震，不過發現新事物還是很讓人興奮！

content.en: There are caves in Taiwan. Maybe one day you'll see how exciting they are!
content.tw: 在台灣也有洞穴。或許有一天你會發現它們有多麼令人興奮！

vocabulary.preface: 洞穴是非常特殊的地形，讓很多人想去探險。

content.text:
1. deep 很深的。
This is the most amazing cave I've ever seen! 這是我見過最驚人的洞穴! How deep underground do you think we are? 你覺得我們在地下多深?
I have no idea. 我不知道。

2. world 世界。
At least 100 meters, I guess. 我猜至少一百公尺。
This is one of the deepest caves in the world, you know.
這裡是世界上最深的洞穴之一。

3. place 地方。
Look at that! That's a little plant! 你看那兒! 那是一棵小植物!
Can you imagine living in a place like this? 你能想像在這種地方生活嗎?

4. light 光線。
No sun, no moon and no light. 沒有太陽，月亮和光線。
Well, at least there's air and water. 至少有空氣和水。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天你學到哪些單字?
deep很深的 world世界 place地方 light光線

quiz.question: 1. Why is going into a cave like going to the moon?
2. What do some caves show about plants?
options: a. They can grow with almost no light.
b. They need a lot of sunlight.

quiz.question: 3. What do some very big caves have?

content.en: A baby hippo is famous. People love her cute face and playful moves.
content.tw: 有一隻活潑可愛的小河馬，廣受大家歡迎。

content.en: Moo Deng is a pygmy hippo. Pygmy hippos are a small kind of hippo. They live in forests. But Moo Deng lives in a zoo.
content.tw: Moo Deng是侏儒河馬，這種小型河馬都在森林中生活，Moo Deng 則是住在動物園裡。

content.en: Moo Deng's zoo is in Thailand. Her zoo made videos of her. People saw the videos online. Everyone loved her. She became a star!
content.tw: Moo Deng的動物園在泰國，園方幫牠拍了影片放在網路上，每個人看了都喜歡，小河馬成了明星!

content.en: Like many babies, Moo Deng bounces around. Her name means "bouncy pig" in Thai. That's a great name for this little hippo!
content.tw: Moo Deng泰國語的意思是彈跳豬，因為牠喜歡蹦蹦跳跳。

content.en: People share funny pictures and stories about her online. And people from all over Thailand go to her zoo. They want to see her!
content.tw: 很多人喜歡分享Moo Deng 的照片和故事，遊客從全泰國各地跑來看這隻著名的小河馬。

content.en: The zoo sells Moo Deng t-shirts and other Moo Deng things. The money helps save pygmy hippos. Saving pygmy hippos is important. There are only about 3,000 of them in the world. Oh no!
content.tw: 動物園有賣跟Moo Deng相關的商品，例如T恤和別的紀念品，而這些錢是用來保護侏儒河馬，這種河馬全球只剩下三千隻。

content.en: What? You can't go to the zoo? That's okay! You can see Moo Deng live online! Moo Deng is cute and bouncy. This baby pygmy hippo is making people all over the world smile!
content.tw: 什麼？你不能去動物園？沒關係！你可以在網路上看Moo Deng的直播！這隻可愛又活潑的小侏儒河馬，正讓全世界的人都微笑！

vocabulary.preface: 泰國可愛的侏儒河馬，是大家喜歡的網紅。

content.text: 1. love 喜愛. I haven't been to Taipei Zoo for a long time. 我好久沒去台北動物園了. Would you like to go with me this weekend? 你這周末想跟我一起去嗎? Sure, I love zoos! 當然，我喜歡動物園.
2. playful 活潑的. Do you want to see any specific animals? 有什麼動物你特別想看? I prefer playful and cute ones. 我比較想看活潑可愛的. Not elephants or turtles.不要大象或是烏龜.
3. cute 可愛的. Hey, I think turtles are cute! 我覺得烏龜很可愛! Anyway, you may like penguins. 你可能會喜歡企鵝. Or pygmy hippos! 或是侏儒河馬!
4. small 小的. Hippos are scary. 河馬很可怕. No, not the big ones. 不是那種大的. Pygmy hippos are small. 侏儒河馬小小的.

vocabulary.postscript: Do you like visiting the zoo? 來複習一下單字 love喜愛 playful活潑的 cute可愛的 small 小的

quiz.question: 1. What is a pygmy hippo?
options: b. A small kind of hippo
c. A big kind of pig

quiz.question: 2. What does Moo Deng's name mean in Thai?
3. How many pygmy hippos are there in the world?
